history.content:
Depending on your experience with 70/confidence with the material, you could go straight into 126. As for probability you need for ML, 140 does cover material like stochastic processes and parameter estimation, and goes into far more theoretical depth than 134, while using computing to help show certain important results. The intent behind creating 140 was that a student could take 140 and be able to understand probability in ML without having taken a theoretical statistics course like 135 (126 serves this purpose, but caters more to EECS students/applications).

If you're currently planning on taking both, then do 140 and 126 if you really want strong foundations in probability and have space in your schedule for 126, as there's significant overlap with 140, but you can't go wrong with taking it again, as you'll learn more material and also strengthen your probability skills. As 134/140 are required for Stats, definitely take 140.

children.subject:
This semester they did accept alternatives.
From the prob140 website: "In Fall 2018 we will accept the following alternatives to Data 8, consistent with the Data 8 “grandfathering” alternatives proposed during the transition towards a new Data Science major. - DS 100 (Stat/CS C100), or - Stat 20 (or 21 or 131A) and CS 61A"
are they pretty strict on the data 8 prereq? Ive taken 61a, and 61b.

history.content:
Hi, 

I'm a Stats and CS major. I need to take either stat 134 or 140 to complete prerequisites for stats major. I believe they do not acknowledge 126. Because I'm interested in ML, I was strongly advised to take 126. I'm currently planning on taking both 134/140 and 126. Does 134/140 cover most of the topics in 126, and would you recommend taking both or just 134/140? Thanks!
history.subject: stats 134 vs stats 140 vs eecs 126
